bwwExcerpt: : But then, there's a lot of love for this energetic telling of the story of Alexander Hamilton...Thomas Kail's direction and Andy Blankenbuehler's choreography is inventive and kinetic, suggesting the story is always in motion on the bilevel wooden set. But "revolutionary" the show is not. Truly radical art is divisive, and under its brash exterior, "Hamilton" is warmly reassuring -- a love letter to a land of opportunity... "Hamilton" shines brightest when it gets into the characters' heads an

keyPhrases.quote: If only every history lesson -- and Broadway musical -- dazzled so completely
Thomas Kail's direction and Andy Blankenbuehler's choreography is inventive and kinetic
